scenario_text.value: Okay, everyone’s here.
T-Takuma, is there really a ghost out there?

There is. I saw it myself after I split up
with Minoru and the others.
Yeep... So it’s totally real...

You’ve gotta be kidding me. Takuma, you sure
you weren’t just seeing things?

No, I know what I saw. It was one of the
companions of the Holy Beasts.

Wait, you mean those people in the shrines
who talk like they’re really old?

Yes, that makes sense. After all, they were
basically ghosts, too.

Exactly. And I think Ryo, Saki, and Minoru
all saw the same boy I did.

Oh... Man, I can’t believe he scared us all
like that! Well, he’s not so scary now!

I...I don’t know... A ghost is a ghost. And
isn’t it weird that he’s left the shrine?

That’s been bothering me too. I think maybe
he’s trying to tell us something.
(I’ll tell them we should track him down...)
to exorcise him.
to find the shrine.
to hear him out.
to exorcise him.
Let’s exorcise him and Zhuqiaomon!

Exorcise them? You...you make it sound like
they’re evil spirits or something...

Well, clearly this spirit has something to
tell us, or he’d still be in the shrine.

Yes, and at the very least, this could serve
as a clue to the shrine’s location.
to find the shrine.

This could be our lucky break to find 
the shrine!
Uh... Yeah, I guess...

You said it, Takuma! The sooner we find that
last Holy Beast, the better.

So whether this kid is a ghost or not, we
gotta track him down and make him talk.

Kaito, don’t be such a brute! You gotta be
nice to ghosts too, you know.
to hear him out.
We should hear what he has to say first.

You’re right. We won’t learn what he wants or
where the shrine is without talking to him.
But...can you even talk to a ghost?

We’ve talked with the people we met in the
shrines. I think it’s worth a shot.

Sounds like we’d better put our dinner plans
on hold.

Mm... Are you sure I can’t keep getting
ready?

Come on, no complaining. This will all be
over faster if everyone helps out.
Good point! Let’s get this over with!
Otherwise I couldn’t enjoy my meal anyway!

(Everyone can see Ryo’s legs are shaking, but
nobody’s giving him a hard time.)
